p: Plant description: Convolvulus pluricaulis ( C. pluricaulis) Choisy is a perennial, wild, prostrate herb, which belongs to the Convulvulaceae family and is mainly found in Northern India. It has long branches of about 30 cm and blue flowers. Its leaves are elliptical in shape and located alternately with flowers and branches [ 230]. It is commonly known as shankhpushpi and is used as a nervine tonic in the Ayurvedic system of medicine, to improve memory and intellect [ 230]. It is classified as Medhya rasayana (promotes intellectual capacity) and Majjadhatu rasayana (rejuvenates the nervous tissue). The leaves of C. pluricaulis have been used for depression and other mental disturbances [ 231].
